name: VRoid Studio Avatar
summary: Learn about .VROID files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: VRoid Studio allows you to create a 3D avatar and export it in the VRM format, for use with VR programs that support the VRM 3D avatar standard. These avatars typically look like anime characters with stylized hair and clothes.

Natively, VRoid Studio saves users' avatars as VROID files. You can open a VROID file in VRoid Studio to edit the avatar it contains. (You cannot open VRM files in VRoid Studio.) By default, VRoid Studio saves users' VROID files in the following directory:

instructions: You can open a VROID file with VRoid Studio (Windows, Mac). To do so, select Open from VRoid Studio's model selection screen. Then, navigate to and open your VROID file.
You can use VRoid Studio to convert a VROID file to the following formats:
To do so, select the Upload button that appears in the program's upper-right corner. Then, select either Export as VRM or Export for 3D Printing.
